usercssData.name: eBay UK Clean 2014 v2.3 (ad-blocker)
usercssData.author: FTD
usercssData.description: This style will hide the "Popular on eBay" right side panel on the search results page and a few others, see full list below.   For best results use the Adblock Plus Firefox/Chrome add-on to remove the most common ads since this userstyle was created to remove only these annoying panels that Adblock Plus can't detect.

author: FTD
description: This style will hide the "Popular on eBay" right side panel on the search results page and a few others, see full list below.   For best results use the Adblock Plus Firefox/Chrome add-on to remove the most common ads since this userstyle was created to remove only these annoying panels that Adblock Plus can't detect.
name: eBay UK Clean 2014 v2.3 (ad-blocker)

usercssData.name: old eBay search format, more radical version
usercssData.author: eanderson
usercssData.description: This is a slightly more radical reversion of the eBay search formatting to an earlier state.  The left-hand sidebar menu (category browser) is narrower with original font size and the annoying animated ad spaces on top and left sides have been vanished.  Grayed-out text (subtitles etc) is returned to solid black. Alternating item list rows are shaded and links are underlined.  ------------  30 Aug 2007: To eliminate the bright yellow background on the sidebar and top searchbox, add these lines to your style:    #matchcats .matchcatecontent {background-color: #efefef !important;}  #basicsearch div {background-color: #fff !important;}  #buyingguides .buyingguidescontent {background-color: #efefef !important;}  #searchoptions #srchOpsDiv {background-color: #efefef !important;}  #productfinder {background-color: #efefef !important;}    ------------  04 Sept 2007: To eliminate the yellow searchbar gradient, add these lines:    #searchtabs {background-image: none !important; list-style-image: none !important; background-color: #fff !important;}  #basicsearch div {border: 1px solid #ccc !important; background-color: #efefef !important;}  #basicsearch div input, #basicsearch div input div {background-color: #fff !important;}  #find label {text-transform: uppercase !important; font-weight: bold !important;}  .r2-nav {background-image: none !important; background-color: #fff !important; border-color: #fff !important;}  .r2-panelHeader {display: none !important;}  .srchBox, .srchBoxE, .srchBoxW {background-image: none !important;}  #expHigh h3 {background-color: #efefef !important;}    ------------    2 Nov 2007: I've eliminated the Guides and Neighborhood boxes on the left-hand column that have inexplicably been placed above search refinement boxes.  To get those back, remove the final two CSS commands.    -----

author: eanderson
description: This is a slightly more radical reversion of the eBay search formatting to an earlier state.  The left-hand sidebar menu (category browser) is narrower with original font size and the annoying animated ad spaces on top and left sides have been vanished.  Grayed-out text (subtitles etc) is returned to solid black. Alternating item list rows are shaded and links are underlined.  ------------  30 Aug 2007: To eliminate the bright yellow background on the sidebar and top searchbox, add these lines to your style:    #matchcats .matchcatecontent {background-color: #efefef !important;}  #basicsearch div {background-color: #fff !important;}  #buyingguides .buyingguidescontent {background-color: #efefef !important;}  #searchoptions #srchOpsDiv {background-color: #efefef !important;}  #productfinder {background-color: #efefef !important;}    ------------  04 Sept 2007: To eliminate the yellow searchbar gradient, add these lines:    #searchtabs {background-image: none !important; list-style-image: none !important; background-color: #fff !important;}  #basicsearch div {border: 1px solid #ccc !important; background-color: #efefef !important;}  #basicsearch div input, #basicsearch div input div {background-color: #fff !important;}  #find label {text-transform: uppercase !important; font-weight: bold !important;}  .r2-nav {background-image: none !important; background-color: #fff !important; border-color: #fff !important;}  .r2-panelHeader {display: none !important;}  .srchBox, .srchBoxE, .srchBoxW {background-image: none !important;}  #expHigh h3 {background-color: #efefef !important;}    ------------    2 Nov 2007: I've eliminated the Guides and Neighborhood boxes on the left-hand column that have inexplicably been placed above search refinement boxes.  To get those back, remove the final two CSS commands.    -----
name: old eBay search format, more radical version

usercssData.name: Another dark Arch Linux theme
usercssData.author: kiwii
usercssData.description: A quick and dirty dark theme for archlinux.org. Works for the front page, wiki, packages, aur & forums. <strike>Forum support coming soon (maybe).</strike> Kinda fixed, I guess.
